meanings.definition: To undermine the power or authority of (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: The villain tried to subvert the hero's plan to save the day.
meanings.sent2: The rebels planned to subvert the oppressive regime.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to subvert the bird feeder by stealing all the seeds.
meanings.sent4: The virus managed to subvert the computer system's defenses.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox used its wiles to subvert the hunter's traps.

meanings.definition: To disrupt or overthrow (an established system or institution)
meanings.sent1: The hackers attempted to subvert the company's network security.
meanings.sent2: The revolution aimed to subvert the monarchy and establish a democracy.
meanings.sent3: The prankster's plan to subvert the school assembly was foiled by the principal.
meanings.sent4: The storm threatened to subvert the fragile sandcastle on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The whistleblower's revelations helped to subvert the corrupt organization.

meanings.sent1: The evil sorcerer sought to subvert the pure-hearted princess with dark magic.
meanings.sent2: The propaganda was used to subvert the truth and manipulate public opinion.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy tried to subvert the training by pretending to be asleep.
meanings.sent4: The forbidden knowledge threatened to subvert the young wizard's mind.
meanings.sent5: The toxic influence of the cult leader began to subvert the community's values.
